articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vulnerable communities were told to seek refuge on higher ground as multiple rivers burst their banks after days of rain in China's flood-hit province of Guizhou, the southwestern end of a seasonal rain belt that stretches all the way to Japan.
articles.title: Heavy rain leaves southwest China under water; more storms on horizon

articles.author: Kanishka Singh, Andrew Mills, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday that a "complete and total" ceasefire between Israel and Iran will go into force with a view to ending the conflict between the two nations.
articles.title: Trump announces Israel-Iran ceasefire

articles.author: Anne Kauranen
articles.title: Fearing war with Russia, Finland hardens NATO’s north frontier

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces killed at least 29 Palestinians in Gaza and ordered new evacuations on Tuesday, local medics and residents said, in further bloodshed shortly after Israel and Iran reached a ceasefire to end a 12-day air war.
articles.title: Israel kills 29 in further Gaza bloodshed after reaching truce with Iran

articles.author: Matt Spetalnick, Jeff Mason, Steve Holland
articles.description: When President Donald Trump sent U.S. bombers to strike Iran’s nuclear sites last weekend, he was betting he could help ally Israel cripple Tehran’s nuclear program while keeping his long-standing vow to avoid entanglement in a protracted war.
articles.title: Big questions loom over Trump's announcement of Israel-Iran ceasefire deal

articles.author: Joyce Lee
articles.description: South Korea's special prosecutor asked a court on Tuesday to issue an arrest warrant for former President Yoon Suk Yeol, an investigator said, marking an intensifying investigation of the ousted leader over his botched bid to impose martial law.
articles.title: South Korea special prosecutor seeks arrest warrant for ex-President Yoon

articles.author: John Irish
articles.description: The leader of a Paris-based Iranian opposition group said after the announcement of a ceasefire in the Iran-Israel air war on Tuesday that the Iranian people should now bring down Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei's system.
articles.title: Dissident leader abroad urges Iranians to bring down Khamenei

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Firefighters were battling to contain wildfires at different locations on the Greek island of Chios for a third day after the island declared a state of emergency.
articles.title: Hundreds of firefighters battle wildfires on Greece's Chios island for third day

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thailand's military has closed border crossings into Cambodia to almost all travellers, including tourists and traders, citing security concerns as tensions between the two Southeast Asian neighbours remain escalated over a simmering border dispute.
articles.title: Thailand closes border crossings with Cambodia as dispute deepens

articles.author: Aaron Ross
articles.description: When protests are expected in Kenya's capital Nairobi, Swaleh Aroko grabs a wooden club and heads downtown.
articles.title: Club-wielding Kenyans vow to 'protect' Nairobi as protest marks deadly anniversary
